psl2table.py - output stats for psl formatted alignments¶

Author:Andreas Heger
Release:$Id$
Date:April 02, 2014
Tags:Python

Purpose¶

Todo

describe purpose of the script.

Usage¶

Example:

python psl2table.py --help

Type:

python psl2table.py --help

for command line help.

Command line options¶

Usage: psl2table.py [options]

Options:
  --version             show program's version number and exit
  -h, --help            show this help message and exit
  --no-usage            output help without usage information
  --mask-lowercase      mask lowercase characters before computing properties
                        [default=False]
  --with-match          echo the match in output [default=True]
  --without-match       do not echo the match in output [default=True]
  -m METHODS, --method=METHODS
                        methods to compute properties between sequence pairs.
  --paml-set-alpha=PAML_ALPHA
                        initial alpha value [default=none].
  --paml-fix-alpha      do not estimate alpha [default=False].
  --paml-set-kappa=PAML_KAPPA
                        initial kappa value [default=none].
  --paml-fix-kappa      do not estimate kappa [default=False].
  --paml-set-clean-data=PAML_CLEAN_DATA
                        PAML should cleanup data:  0=only gaps within pair are
                        removed, 1=columns in the mali with gaps are removed
                        [default=none].
  --baseml-model=BASEML_MODEL
                        baseml model [default=REV].
  -v LOGLEVEL, --verbose=LOGLEVEL
                        loglevel [1]. The higher, the more output.
  --timeit=TIMEIT_FILE  store timeing information in file [none].
  --timeit-name=TIMEIT_NAME
                        name in timing file for this class of jobs [all].
  --timeit-header       add header for timing information [none].
  --random-seed=RANDOM_SEED
                        random seed to initialize number generator with
                        [none].
  -I FILE, --stdin=FILE
                        file to read stdin from [default = stdin].
  -L FILE, --log=FILE   file with logging information [default = stdout].
  -E FILE, --error=FILE
                        file with error information [default = stderr].
  -S FILE, --stdout=FILE
                        file where output is to go [default = stdout].
